Based on your preferences, I recommend two movies from this list: "Hotel Rwanda" (2004) and "The Pianist" (2002). Both movies share a similar theme of survival in the face of adversity. "Hotel Rwanda" tells the story of a hotel manager named Paul Rusesabagina who faces various struggles as he loses contact with his family during the Rwandan genocide. "The Pianist" is based on the true-life story of Wladyslaw Szpilman, an acclaimed Polish musician who survived the Holocaust by hiding in the ruins of Warsaw in order to survive.
Both movies feature compelling performances from a talented cast, including Scott Adsit as Paul Rusesabagina, Antony Starr as Jost Spitalmann, Bonnie Somerville as Anna Spitalmann, Frank Finlay as Koen Stettler, Emilia Fox as Mieke Spitalmann, Ed Stoppard as Max Stettler, Mhairi Calvey as Niki Spitalmann, Patrick McGoohan as Pieter 'Pietje' van der Mer, Patrick McGoohan as Piet, Leleti Khumalo as Fani Stettler, Nick Nolte as Joss, Sophie Okonedo as Mieke, Sophie Okoned 生命周期
